血がつながる: (ちがつながる) - to be related (by blood)
血が流れる: (ちがながれる) - blood flows; (usu. ...の血が流れる) to have the blood of ... running in one's veins (artist, warrior, etc.)/to be born with particular skills, characteristics, etc./to have something "in one's blood"
血が繋がる: (ちがつながる) - to be related (by blood)

血だまり: (ちだまり) - puddle of blood; pool of blood

血のり: (ちのり) - clotted blood; gore; sticky clots of blood

血の巡りの悪い: (ちのめぐりのわるい) - dim-witted; slow to catch on

血の気が引く: (ちのけがひく) - to go pale; to grow pale; to lose color; to turn white
血の池: (ちのいけ) - Blood Pond; pool of blood; pond of blood (in hell)
血の海: (ちのうみ) - sea of blood; pool of blood
血の涙: (ちのなみだ) - bitter tears; tears of blood
血の通った: (ちのかよった) - warm; blood-circulating; compassionate

血も涙も無い: (ちもなみだもない) - cold-blooded; unfeeling; heartless; heart of stone; inconsiderate

血中: (けっちゅう) - blood content; blood borne/within the blood
